plan: To maximize long-term profit, I'll explore varying bidding strategies. Initially, I'll test the dominant strategy of bidding 50% of my value to establish a baseline. In subsequent rounds, I'll experiment with more aggressive bids, like 70% and 90% of my value, to assess if higher bids yield better outcomes. I'll also try conservative bids, like 30%, to evaluate risk minimization. By analyzing the outcomes of these strategies, I'll adjust dynamically based on observed patterns in opponents' bidding behaviors, aiming to optimize my profit while balancing risk and reward.

In the first five rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding 50% of my value to establish a baseline. In the next five rounds, I'll experiment with aggressive bids, ranging from 60% to 80% of my value, to identify potential profit increases. For the final five rounds, I'll alternate between conservative bids (40% to 50%) and aggressive bids based on observed behaviors and outcomes from Andy and Charles. This approach balances data gathering and adaptability, aiming to maximize long-term profit by adjusting to opponents' strategies while exploring both risky and conservative options.

In the initial rounds, I'll test a mix of conservative and aggressive strategies. I'll start by bidding 50% of my value to establish a baseline, then gradually increase to 70% and 90% to gauge opponent reactions. If opponents consistently bid close to their values, I'll explore underbidding at 30% to 40% for potential profit from overbidders. I'll also test occasional high-risk bids above value to disrupt patterns and gather data on opponent thresholds. Throughout, I'll analyze bid patterns to adjust strategies dynamically, aiming to maximize profit by exploiting opponents' predictable behaviors.

Next, I'll test bidding 70% of my value to explore more aggressive strategies. I'll adjust based on opponents' patterns, aiming for higher profit without excessive risk. If this proves ineffective, I'll try 30% to minimize losses, continuously refining my approach for optimal long-term gains.

In rounds 1-5, continue bidding 50% of value. In rounds 6-10, test aggressive bids at 60%-80%. In rounds 11-15, alternate between 40%-50% and aggressive bids, adjusting based on Andy's and Charles's patterns to optimize profits and gather strategic insights.
